title: Kinghorn Loch Walking Route

nearby.description: Dalgety Bay to Aberdour Coastal Path
Lower Largo to Shell Bay and Elie Coastal Walk

images.title: John Darcy / Kinghorn Loch
images.caption: Kinghorn Loch. Craigencalt Farm Ecology Centre and Community Woodland, and the closely associated boat launching area is a very popular location for anglers

images.title: Paul McIlroy / Craigencalt Ecology Centre
images.caption: Craigencalt Ecology Centre. Situated on north shore of Kinghorn Loch this environmental education centre offers practical demonstrations and examples of alternative forms of energy, recycling etc

images.title: Robin Clark / Three stoojes
images.caption: Three stoojes. The loch which is part of a project which that is self efficient. There is much to see at the park and hope they keep up the great work.

images.title: Cemitchell at English Wikipedia, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Loch from the bird hide

description: This pretty little loch is located just inland of the coastal settlements of Kinghorn and Burntisland in Fife. At the site there's some nice waterside and woodland trails plus a bird hide where you can look out for a variety of water loving birds. At the northern side of the water there's the Earthship Fife Visitor Centre where you can enjoy a bite to eat at the cafe.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: In nearby Elie there's also the exhilarating Elie and Earlsferry Chain Walk to try. This challenging scramble takes you along rocky path with fascinating geology and fine coastal views.Head to Burntisland and you could pick up the Aberdour to Burntisland Coastal Path which runs along the epic Fife Coastal Path. Head west and there's more nice lochside paths in Dunfermline around Loch Fitty and Townhill Country Park.

display_address: Woodland Rise, Craigencalt Farm, Kinghorn, Fife, Alba / Scotland, KY3 9YG, United Kingdom
